intro: Persicaria lapathifolia subsp. pallida, commonly known as pale willow herb, is a flowering plant in the Polygonaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist or wet habitats such as marshes and stream banks. The plant features slender, upright stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are lance-shaped with a distinctive reddish tinge. It produces small, clustered greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The subspecies pallida is distinguished by its pale coloration and reduced floral structures compared to other subspecies of Persicaria lapathifolia.
